member.name: TYMED
member.summary: Indicates the type of storage medium being used in a data transfer. They are used in the or structures.

member.name: TYMED.TYMED_HGLOBAL
member.summary: The storage medium is a global memory handle (HGLOBAL). Allocate the global handle with the GMEM_MOVEABLE flag. If the punkForRelease member of is NULL, the destination process should use to release the memory.

member.name: TYMED.TYMED_FILE
member.summary: The storage medium is a disk file identified by a path. If the punkForRelease member is NULL, the destination process should use to delete the file.

member.name: TYMED.TYMED_ISTREAM
member.summary: The storage medium is a stream object identified by an pointer. Use to read the data. If the punkForRelease member is not NULL, the destination process should use to release the stream component.

member.name: TYMED.TYMED_ISTORAGE
member.summary: The storage medium is a storage component identified by an pointer. The data is in the streams and storages contained by this IStorage instance. If the punkForRelease member is not NULL, the destination process should use to release the storage component.

member.name: TYMED.TYMED_GDI
member.summary: The storage medium is a GDI component (HBITMAP). If the punkForRelease member is NULL, the destination process should use to delete the bitmap.

member.name: TYMED.TYMED_MFPICT
member.summary: The storage medium is a metafile (METAFILEPICT). Use the GDI functions to access the metafile's data. If the punkForRelease member is NULL, the destination process should use to delete the bitmap.

member.name: TYMED.TYMED_ENHMF
member.summary: The storage medium is an enhanced metafile (HENHMETAFILE). If the punkForRelease member is NULL, the destination process should use to delete the bitmap.
